title: Why did y'all nerf the towers?
body:
You replaced the inhib/nexus turrets with the outer turrets.... wtf.... Now they can't barely kill a super minion let alone 2. Who the hell designed this?

EDIT- Still waiting on a red post...

Nexus Turrets are legitimately inadequate.

I think it'd be cool if they combined both outer and inner turret designs to them, so lasers and shots are going out at the same time on the same target.

rito made the change cuz they wanted us to be able to [farm undertower](https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=how+to+farm+under+tower), even when turtling, n having lasers and shots targetting the same target would destroy the whole purpose of the tower changes.

what i think rito rly should do is either make towers like 3x stronger but deal 67% reduced damage to non-super minions, or make towers shoot 3x faster
I'd be content if they just shot faster and did True Damage to champions.
shoot faster yea. true damage to champions why?
To prevent diving?
How do you end the game then with the enemy team all right under towers? :T

You can still dive under the Nexus Turrets. They'll deal more damage, but after a certain point it becomes a moot factor regardless because turrets stop scaling on top of champion HP being much higher at Level 18. 

You can end the game in so many ways without having to dive the enemy under their Nexus Turrets. Taking 2-3 inhibitors as a team, grouped, will end most games lest your team makes really stupid decisions. Games will end even faster if you have Elder Dragon/Baron, and minions can still easily tank as your team blasts the turrets down. 

For scope, we're talking about maybe a 200-300 Damage increase here. Unless your ADC/APC is face-tanking a Nexus Turret like a total baboon, the strategies used in the past will still be viable.
By diving. True damage wouldn't make diving impossible, but it would keep the difficulty of a dive u while making farming easier(since the turrets would be hitting less anyways)

Towers already do a specific % damage to normal minions (always takes 3 shots to kill full health melee, always 2 for full health casters, ~7 for siege). They can just increase the damage dealt to supers.

They should make them shoot faster so that they can take care of super minions with out any problems and have the same rate for regular minions. 

Honestly. I do miss the melting lazer alot.
It was great and punished tower divers a lot. Also it was funny on how quickly the damage ramped up.

(Riot stated that the new turrets were implemented because people couldn't farm under nexus and inhib turrets)

They might've been shit in late game, but they were still infinitely stronger.

Don't forget that minions get vastly stronger the more you are ahead.

Remember when people complained that the laser turrets felt like massive nerfs to the turrets they replaced -_-
A further nerf to a previous nerf is still a nerf. That and these turrets are not the same as the old ones.

I saw in my game 1 freaking super minion accompanied by his 3 melee and 3 caster minions took down both towers .-. like WTF riot these turrets can barely handle 1 super minions when the others could atleast hold their ground against 2 or even 3 if they targeted them right, but these old turrets just suck, seems like they don't want the game to last long after the first inhib is downed. {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

To be fair, losing an inhib at all should be a massive impediment to your own progress for losing it in the first place.  Like how if you lose a lane of barracks, the Dota equivalent of an inhib, you never get it back and will permanently have super creeps running down that lane, and if you lose all 3 lanes, you're just straight fucked.  No comeback.  

Sounds more like a reason to either play smart or get fucking dunked.  Maybe Rito is telling you to git gud, maybe they're just batshit insane again, no one will ever know.
Yes, an impediment indeed. I should have to prevent my turrets from losing half their health, not lose both of them to 1 1/2-2 waves.
Could you explain the part after the impediment bit?  I don't quite understand what you mean.
IT should have to draw your attention, and god forbid you let the minions pile up. But if you were to miss one wave that shouldn't be all it takes to lose 1-2 nexus turrets.
To be fair, you can lose both your final towers instantly if you lose all 3 barracks in Dota, and THOSE Super Minions are a whole wave of the equivalent to League's super minion.

Ya this change makes negative sense. Apparently someone at Riot tried to make the argument that the laser turrets were inconsistent because they weren't the same as the rest of the "normal turrets" but then again, that was the fucking point, and seeing as how inhib turrets are lasers also, it's 5 laser turrets and 6 "normal" turrets.
I miss the laser turrets. They were the coolest map alterations in a long time. I preferred that to even Herald and dragons lol

If I recall, the reason for the change was how difficult it was to farm under them. Another thing to consider is the tower doing more damage does not increase how long the tower will last under siege. Riot's objective with putting lasers on the tower was to discourage heavy split pushers from killing towers without having an allied creep wave nearby (as SEVERAL champions were capable of in the past aka Pantheon, Udyr, etc). Many champions and items have since those days been adjusted and overall the pace of the game is a lot faster than before. Due to all the recent changes, the reason for adjusting the towers were basically nullified and no longer make sense, especially considering how much it affected the ability to last hit under tower.

FYI: _What most of you in this thread are crying about isn't tower damage. What you are asking for is to have TANKIER TOWERS (i.e. more health, armor, magic resist, damage reduction, etc)._
I'd rather have turrets actually do damage thanks. Marksmen should not be able to tank turrets with relative ease.
Give nexus towers AoE!
